name: Fun
statement: Counting is Fun! — satyam343 Given two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$x$$$, find the number of triplets ($$$a,b,c$$$) of positive integers such that $$$ab + ac + bc \le n$$$ and $$$a + b + c \le x$$$. Note that order matters (e.g. ($$$1, 1, 2$$$) and ($$$1, 2, 1$$$) are treated as different) and $$$a$$$, $$$b$$$, $$$c$$$ must be strictly greater than $$$0$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. Each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$x$$$ ($$$1 \leq n,x \leq 10^6$$$). It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^6$$$ and that the sum of $$$x$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^6$$$.
outputFormat: Output a single integer — the number of triplets ($$$a,b,c$$$) of positive integers such that $$$ab + ac + bc \le n$$$ and $$$a + b + c \le x$$$.
